document_data.name: ''Ever Watchful''
document_data.mainbody: '''''Ever Watchful''''', later known as '''''Vindicator''''', was the favored weapon of [[Helm]], the [[deity]] of guardians and protectors.{{cite book/Faiths and Pantheons|28}}
document_data.Description: ''Ever Watchful'' was a mighty [[bastard sword]] that Helm preferred to wield two-handed. The sword had the symbol of Helm (a watchful eye with a blue pupil emblazoned on an upright [[gauntlet]]) on its hilt. It glowed with silvery flame, and anyone unworthy of wielding it felt a burning sensation when they grasped it.
document_data.Powers:
In the hands of Helm's [[avatar]], the weapon was an incredibly powerful ''[[keen]]'' bastard sword that was both ''[[Holy (weapon quality)|holy]]'' and ''[[lawful]]''. It therefore struck hardest against [[evil]] and [[chaotic]] foes, and such creatures would be weakened should they touch the sword.{{cite book/Faiths and Pantheons|30}}<ref group="note">''Ever Watchful'' was a ''+4 [[Holy (weapon quality)|holy]] [[keen]] [[lawful]] bastard sword'' in ''[[Faiths and Pantheons]]'', and was given as a ''+3 bastard sword'' in the earlier ''[[Faiths & Avatars]]''. It had no formal statistics in [[4th edition]].

Among mortals who were deemed worthy to wield it, ''Ever Watchful'' could be recalled to their hands regardless of where it was.{{Cite digital book/Eye of Justice}} These individuals also had the ability to wreathe themselves in an [[Armor of faith (spell)|''armor of faith'']] that manifested as luminous grey [[plate mail]]. The grey color of both the armor and the sword's flames were said to represent the [[lawful neutral]] ideology of Helm's justice: neither evil (black) nor good (white).
document_data.Reputation:
[[File:Shadowbane Hi-res.jpg|thumb|195px|Shadowbane wielding ''Vindicator'', aka ''Ever Watchful''.]]
As the calling card of the holy vigilante Shadowbane, ''Ever Watchful'' (known as ''Vindicator'') was an object of both terror and veneration throughout the 15{{th}} century [[DR]] in both [[Waterdeep]] and [[Westgate]].

Notable Owners.Divine owners: *[[Helm]], the Watcher and God of Guardians
Notable Owners.Mortal owners:
*[[Gedrin Shadowbane|Gedrin "Shadowbane" Thalvar]], who received the sword upon having visions of Helm's death in [[1384 DR]].
*[[Kalen Dren|Kalen "Shadowbane" Dren]], the second Shadowbane.
*[[Rhetegast Hawkwinter]], the third Shadowbane, who represented "Mercy."
*[[Vaelis]], another heir to the title of Shadowbane, who represented "Vengence."
